text.author: George Chriss
text.title: Penn State Wiki Proposal Defense (Chriss, 2006)
text.summary1: (human1) In a May 2006 letter to Penn State Undergraduate Dean Robert Pangborn, student and wiki advocate George Chriss defends his proposal for a student-based university wiki as a complement to the University’s official course description and effective course feedback pipeline, after Penn’s decision against wiki on grounds of potential misinformation and management difficulties.
text.summary2: (claude-3-5-sonnet-20241022) George Chriss, a Penn State University student and Wikimedia Foundation editor, writes to Vice President Pangborn to propose implementing a wiki-based system for student course descriptions, addressing previous administrative concerns and suggesting a pilot program to test the technology's effectiveness.
text.summary3: (gpt4o) On May 8, 2006, George Chriss wrote to Penn State's Vice President Robert Pangborn advocating for a student-based course description wiki, arguing its benefits for transparency and feedback despite University concerns about misinformation, and proposing a pilot program to evaluate its feasibility and effectiveness.
text.summary4: (Meta-Llama-3-8B-Instruct) Penn State student George Chriss submits a proposal to establish a wiki to provide student-based course descriptions, addressing concerns about accuracy and responsibility.
text.summary5: (Qwen2.5-7B-Instruct) An undergraduate student government representative proposes implementing a pilot program using wiki technology for student-based course descriptions at Penn State, emphasizing its potential benefits and accuracy, and requests a meeting to discuss further.
